heaviest_rainfall.status: The heaviest total rainfall occurred on 04 January 2025, dropping 36.8mm of rain over the 37.2 hour storm duration with a maximum rate of 4.6mm per hour.

heaviest_rainrate.status: 27.0mm per hour is the maximum rain rate ever recorded on 02 September 2025, during a 15.0 hour storm which dumped 21.19mm of rain from the clouds.

longest_rain.status: The lengthiest precipitation event recorded spanned 37.2 hours on 04 January 2025, it was characterized by a peak rain intensity of 4.6mm per hour and a total rainfall of 36.8mm.

most_lightning.status: The highest recorded number of lightning strikes in a single day is {highest_count} on {highest_date} since records began on 11 April 2025.

storm.status: No stormy weather is anticipated.  The last big storm was recorded on 13 October 2025, lasting 1 day.

top_10_dry.status: The longest dry period started on 24 April 2025 and lasted for 19 days.

top_10_rainy.status: The longest rainy period started on 30 November 2024 and lasted for 10 days.

cold_snaps.status: There is not a cold snap right now.  There have been 6 this year, compared to a usual average of 3.7.

extreme.status: The record temperature difference stands at 26.7°C (0.4 - 27.1°C), set on 29 April 2025.

heatwaves.status: There is currently no heatwaves.  This year there have been 6 heatwavess, usually there are 1.9 heatwavess per year.

tropical.status: The last observed tropical night was 18 July 2025, making a total of only 62 times since 1973.

average.status: The current average daily wind direction is southerly (185°), which differs from the daily average south-westerly (231.0°) by approximately 46.0 degrees.    In the UK, a southerly wind usually brings milder, moist air from the Atlantic.

gusts.status: The highest wind gust ever seen is 93.7 mph on 13 October 2012.

run.status: The top recorded wind run is 1737 miles on 21 October 2012.

speed.status: The largest wind speed ever was on 13 October 2012 with a value of 93.7 mph.

top_10_windy.status: The longest windy period started on 11 October 2012 and lasted for 21 days.

summary.description:
Compared to today, yesterday also had noticeable differences in light levels (up 5487 lux) and cloud levels (up 354 m).

The past week and month had observable variation in light levels (up 7236 lux), cloud levels (up 440 m), and inside temperature (up 1.9°C) when compared to today.

The cloud levels yesterday fell between 1116m minimum and 2360m maximum, with an average of 1141.0m; weekly and monthly averages were marginally higher at 1257.2m and 1580.6m.

summary.summary: Inside; temperature should feel pleasantly mild. Outside; moderate and mild. Also, pleasant humidity levels and winds will be practically absent. Chance of light rain, clouds will occasionally block sunlight, and the light is absent. Weather patterns to stay the same.

washing.phrase: The humidity is too high (90%) for your washing to dry quickly.  Any drying will take longer than usual.
